page.title: 05RECLAIMING LAND AT GRASSMOOR
page.content: Grassmoor and Williamthorpe Colliery tips grew for over a hundred years into ugly mountains of waste. Now these unsightly scars are being removed. The out-cropping of coal is almost completed; over one million tonnes have been removed from the site north of Grassmoor. The reclamation was started in 1975 and should be finished by 1987. Then most of the land will be returned to agriculture. Some, however, will be used to create recreational facilities including parkland and a golf course. Land already reclaimed is being fenced and grassed. Lakes and ponds have been left to add beauty and give provision for fishing. Footpaths have been restored and the area is gaining a more natural appearance.
